snippet: An appeals court ruled that a debt collection agency misled borrowers by claiming their student loans could not be discharged in bankruptcy.
abstract: United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit rules that Collecto, a debt collection agency working to collect loans backed by the Education Department, misled borrowers by telling them their debt was not dischargeable in bankruptcy.
lead_paragraph: An appeals court ruled that a debt collection agency misled borrowers by claiming their student loans could not be discharged in bankruptcy.
